revised_title: Development of a Concave Achromatic Lens for Wired Micrometers
tldr: George Dollond developed a concave achromatic lens that could increase the primary image of a telescope without increasing the diameter of the wires in the micrometer. This lens, named Macro-Micro, was tested by examining Saturn's satellites and the companion of k Geminorum, showing no significant difference in brightness. Professor Barlow provided formulae for constructing the lens.
